intro: Viburnum wardii, commonly known as the African snowberry, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It features compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers in the spring. The plant bears bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Viburnum wardii typically grows in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
